title: China's 996.ICU Movement: 240,000+ GitHub Stars Before Censorship (2019)
description: Document China's 996.ICU movement protesting brutal 9am-9pm, 6-day work weeks, which garnered over 240,000 GitHub stars before authorities censored it, and its connection to international tech worker resistance.
research_areas: How did the 996.ICU movement organize and spread on GitHub in 2019?
Which specific Chinese tech companies were targeted by the protests?
How did Chinese authorities respond to and censor the movement?
What connections existed between 996.ICU and international tech worker movements?
How did the Tang Ping ('Lying Flat') movement evolve from 996.ICU resistance?
source_requirements: GitHub repository records, censorship documentation, worker testimony, corporate response records, international solidarity statements
pdf_source: Technology Worker Resistance and Constitutional Cryptography_ Tools for Democratic Resilience.pdf
